npcs.name: Sister Elarra
dialogue: You fought brilliantly. The Allfather's forge burns brighter for your courage.
We lost some good people in the attack, but the chapel still stands. That's what matters.
The shrine is yours to use, as always. And if you need equipment tended to, I'm here.
Go carefully. The Hushed Choir will not forgive what happened here today.

npcs.name: Dante
dialogue: The streets are crawling with Ledgermen and cultists. We can't go out the front door anymore.
But I told you I had a lead on some old smuggling tunnels, didn't I? Turns out they run right under the chapel.
There's a passage through the east wall here that connects to the tunnel network. We can use it to move unseen.

npcs.name: Old Brewer
dialogue: A damned fiend! In our chapel! If the Allfather weren't watching over us, we'd all be dead.
But we held. We actually held. Haven't felt this alive in years.

npcs.name: Zeke
dialogue: That bug monster was SO scary! But you smashed it! I saw the whole thing from behind the pews!
Everyone's saying you're the real deal now. Not just talk.

npcs.name: Chapel Guard
dialogue: I won't lie — when that thing came through the door, I nearly dropped my spear.
But then I saw you lot charge right at it. Figured if you could face it, so could I.

npcs.name: Child
dialogue: The big bug is gone, right? It's not coming back?
Zeke says you punched it in the face. Is that true?

npcs.name: Refugee Woman
dialogue: They attacked our sanctuary. Our chapel. There's no pretending this is just politics anymore.
Whatever you need from us, you have it. We're in this together now.

npcs.name: Child
dialogue: Papa came back from the House of Respite! He says the Stoutwaters are with us!
He also says we have to stay inside for a while. But that's okay.

npcs.name: Young Guard
dialogue: They came in through every entrance. We weren't ready. Next time, we will be.
I'm doubling the watch. No one gets through those doors without us knowing.

npcs.name: Grateful Refugee
dialogue: I heard Dante's found a way through the tunnels. Smart man. The streets aren't safe for anyone right now.
The Ledgermen have checkpoints on every corner. And those cultists... they're looking for us.

introCutscene.speaker: Narrator
introCutscene.text: The chapel is quiet now. The acrid smell of the Mezzoloth's remains still lingers in the air.

introCutscene.speaker: Narrator
introCutscene.text: The people of Sparkworks tend to the wounded and shore up the defenses.

arden: I know I know. I really should wear a helmet. It's important to protect the money maker.
But the people sure seem to find their courage when I flash them a smile!
ty: I can't believe we actually did that. A real fiend. We fought a real fiend and we're still standing.
These people are looking at us like we're... heroes or something. That's new.
thorn: The storm has passed. But the sky remains dark. We should speak with the people here — they will need reassurance.
The roots of this chapel run deep. We will learn much by nourishing them.
veil: The people here fought alongside us. That takes courage. We shouldn't waste it.
We should talk to Sister Elarra. If the Choir targeted this place specifically, there's a reason.
quin: Dante said something about tunnels. We should find him — we'll need a way to move without being seen.
The Ledgermen will hear about this. We need to be gone before they come knocking.
